com.radirius.mercury.graphics
Class Texture

java.lang.Object
  com.radirius.mercury.graphics.Texture
All Implemented Interfaces:
Resource, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SubTexture
public class Texture
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource

An object version of a texture. This will store the width and height of the object.

Author:
wessles, Jeviny

Constructor Detail

Texture

public Texture(int textureId,
               int width,
               int height,
               java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Make a texture of the textureId, with a width and height, based off of bufferedimage buf.

Parameters:
textureId - The id of the texture.
width - The width of the texture.
height - The height of the texture.
bufferedImage - The source of the image, the BufferedImage.
buffer - The original buffer.

public static Texture getEmptyTexture()
Returns:

setExpandToPowerOfTwo

public static void setExpandToPowerOfTwo(boolean expandToPoT)
Sets whether or not all Textures will be expanded to the nearest power of two. Keep in mind before you change this: PoT Textures allow for great things like GL_REPEAT and faster rendering time. Certain aspect of the library may break, should you choose to mess with this value. You can use the non-PoT SubTextures in much the same for the most part. Use at your own risk.
